Carlsen in giant trouble: - An earthquake in chess
Magnus Carlsen lost Friday's first game. Now he needs a huge turnaround to take home the World Cup gold.
01 Nov 2019, 18:19 by Sondre Moen Myhre

The case is being updated.


Magnus Carlsen - Wesley So 1.5 - 7.5

HEAVY CODE: - These are numbers we could never have imagined before, said NRK expert Torstein Bae.
Carlsen was a huge favorite before the World Cup in fishing chess started against Wesley So. But after only three games, the Filipino-born American So has one hand on the gold.
- Sensational. We have to say that, the expert added.
So was naturally very happy after the victory. Now he eyes the World Cup title.
- Of course I'm very happy. It was unexpected, So told NRK.
Carlsen also lost the last game on Thursday, and is now six points behind. The first one to reach 12.5 points wins the gold.
- Then we talk about an earthquake in the world of chess, if So takes a new victory and leads 7.5-1.5. Then Magnus is completely dependent on winning the last game to snap in, Bae said along the way in Friday's first game.

The Carlsen camp still has faith
Although Carlsen has come out unscathed in the World Cup final, chances are victorious. Espen Agdestein, Carlsen's manager, believes that Norwegian triumph is still likely.
- He (Carlsen) tends to land on his feet, even though he is under severe pressure. He really wants to win this here. There are still many points that So should have. If it turns a bit, it can turn very quickly. I'm still an optimist, he said just after Carlsen's loss.
Yet Agdestein admits that So has surprised him.
- So has played incredibly well, I must say. When he got the advantage in the party he was deadly precise all the way. As a rule, it doesn't help to beat Magnus once. You have to do it time and time again. But So has been impressive so far, says Agdestein.
He receives support from Aftenposten's chess columnist Atle GrÃ¸nn. He thinks the American big game frustrates Carlsen, but believes the Norwegian has several strings to play.
- If Magnus wins the next game I would say he is a favorite. That's what determines everything. If he loses next, he is hopelessly hopeless, says the expert.


Espen Agdestein has by no means given up the World Cup victory.ğŸ“· Pontus HÃ¶Ã¶k / NTB scanpix

New loss cover
In Thursday's loss, the two World Cup finalists played what was described as perfect chess until move 35. Then came the crucial loss from Carlsen.
In Friday's party, however, it was already trouble from the start. But little by little, Carlsen struggled into the party.
This time it held to the 37th move. Then Carlsen played his horse for the D4 and the chess computers made a big impact.
- This looks like a big mistake by Magnus Carlsen, Bae noted.
For So, on the other hand, it was important to find the one trait that still provided a great advantage.

Applauded Carlsen's opponent
Then both players ended up in time as they approached the 40th move which gives fifteen minutes extra time.
So did not find the most accurate features, while Carlsen in turn made another move that gave So further advantage.
Bae thought So played in a very unique way. He does not remember that other competitors have played with the same calm against Carlsen.
- I think Wesley So is ice cold. He plays so fast in this situation. He must know that he is immensely close to a new victory. Still, he only spends seconds. Which other player, in the match with Magnus, would be able to do that? They would hesitate, they would think, they would not clear this pressure. But Wesley So just looks terrifying, Bae said.
